body:
Now that I think about it, this would break if the component was not rendered by another route.

My issue is that I have a component that is always rendered using `children` which animates in/out. The component being rendered uses `withRouter` which unmounts immediately for some reason, instead of remaining mouted, preventing me from doing the leave animation.
It renders a pathless `<Route>`, which means it always matches (so `render` is the same as `children`).

Closing because I'm confident pathless routes don't cause remounting, we'd need a test case proving otherwise. Something else is going on in your app to cause that. If you're sure its our problem, please make a test case whether on codepen or as a failing test in the repo. Thanks :)
I was using it like adviced, `export default withRouter(component)` . Removing the `withRouter` part fixed it for me so I'll live with those implications for now.

rename.to: Pathless <Route> inside of <Route children> breaks when parent route's path does not match

body: @ryanflorence I believe that this is actually a bug emanating from f90d753.

issue.title: Fix pathless route's match when parent is null
issue.body:
This moves the logic for getting the match object for a pathless `<Route>` `matchPath`. When automatic path resolving is added, `matchPath` will need access to the parent `match`, so we will need to pass that argument to `matchPath` eventually anyways.

When a parent `match` is `null`, a match object with default values is returned by `matchPath`. This match object should not be relied upon for resolving paths, but it will allow a `<Route>` that uses the `component` or `render` prop to render.

Fixes #4695

issue.title: withRouter wrapped component only renders when NavLink is active
issue.body:
## Version
4.1.1

## Test Case
https://codepen.io/penx/pen/jmeEXz

## Steps to reproduce

Create a NavLink with a child component that is wrapped with `withRouter`.

## Expected Behavior

The child component should always render when the NavLink is rendered.

## Actual Behavior

The child component only renders when the NavLink is active.


(I have a fix for this - will submit a pull request shortly)

issue.title: Please merge the relative route PRs
issue.body:
#4695 #4539 are as ready as they can be. Relative routes are sorely missing and they are the keystone to making pluggable application parts.

I tried making it work by wrapping `<Route>`, but then it turns out I also needed to wrap `<Redirect>` and in fact completely replace `<Switch>`, since the `matchPath` logic can't be overridden.

Relative links are a different beast, so just having relative Routes will already be nice. Child-only links like ``<Link to={`./${item.id}`}/>`` or `<Redirect to="./home" />` would be nice but they can easily be done with a wrapper.

body: Is the recommended workaround still what @Shrugs suggested, and/or is there any other fix?

I wrote a fix for #5141 (#5142) which was closed as a duplicate of this ticket. The PR has been open for 9 months without feedback, other than "they are not ready yet" loosely relating to this in https://github.com/ReactTraining/react-router/issues/5852

Any chance on some feedback on this PR?

I spent so long on this bug . Everything I read kept saying I had an update blocking issue and I should use `withRouter`.

@Shrugs solution ended up working for me.
